relations.head: Gtr1p(GTP)-Gtr2p(GDP) heterodimer
relations.label: bind
relations.text: The heterodimer between GTP-loaded RagA/B and GDP-loaded RagC/D is the most active form that binds Raptor and leads to the activation of TORC1.

relations.head: Gtr1p(GTP)-Gtr2p(GDP) heterodimer
relations.label: activate
relations.text: The heterodimer between GTP-loaded RagA/B and GDP-loaded RagC/D is the most active form that binds Raptor and leads to the activation of TORC1.

analysis:
Context:  
Since this study focuses on the structural and mechanistic details of Rag/Gtr GTPases without mention of any specific disease model, specialized primary tissue/cells, or pathological/environmental stress, the context is “none” (Undefined/Generic).

────────────────────────────────────────
Nodes (with type and status):
1) Gtr1p(GTP)-Gtr2p(GDP) heterodimer → protein, none  
2) Raptor → protein, none  
3) TORC1 → protein, none  

No other nodes are explicitly required for the main regulatory mechanism described in the abstract.

────────────────────────────────────────
Regulatory Relationships (Direct):
1) Gtr1p(GTP)-Gtr2p(GDP) heterodimer binds Raptor  
2) Gtr1p(GTP)-Gtr2p(GDP) heterodimer activates TORC1  

────────────────────────────────────────
